snippet: The unusual circumstance of Pope Benedict XVI’s plan to retire at the end of this month presents a series of questions for the Vatican to address.
abstract: Unusual circumstance of Pope Benedict XVI’s plan to retire at end of Feb 2013 presents series of questions for the Vatican to address, from how former pope will be addressed to what to do with papal ring used to seal important documents, traditionally destroyed upon pope’s death.

byline.contributor: Alan Cowell contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: The unusual circumstance of Pope Benedict XVI’s plan to retire at the end of this month presents a series of questions for the Vatican to address.

headline.seo: After Retirement, Pope Will Live in Vatican City
headline.main: Benedict Will Live in Vatican City, but Many Details Remain Undecided
headline.print_headline: Benedict Will Live in Vatican City, but Many Details Remain Undecided
